sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 Two isosceles triangles have equal vertical angles and their areas are in the ratio \(4:1\).
 Find the ratio of their corresponding heights.\\ 
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
 Let $ABC$ and $PQR$ be two isosceles triangles such that $AB=AC$, $PQ = PR$, $\angle A = \angle P $
 $ \dfrac{area of \Delta ABC}{area of \Delta PQR} = \dfrac{4}{1}$
 Draw perpendicular $AD$ on $BC$ and $PM$ on $QR$.
 tikzpicture{} 
 Now, $AB = AC$ and $PQ = PR$
 $\dfrac{AB}{PQ} = \dfrac{AC}{PR}$
 $\Delta ABC \sim \Delta PQR$
 As the triangle is Similar, the ratio of their area is equal to ratio of square of their any two corresponding sides.
 $\dfrac{area of \Delta ABC}{area of \Delta PQR} = \dfrac{{AD}^2}{{PM}^2}$
 $\Rightarrow \left(\dfrac{4}{1}\right) = \left(\dfrac{AD}{PM}\right)^2$
 $\Rightarrow$ AD : PM = 2 : 1.
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
